Welcome to api-scrapin’s documentaiton

Quick search

Enter search terms or a module, class or function name.

api-scrapin¶

An aggregator for different apsects of the Zillow.com API, some tidbits of Wikipedia, and of course, shitloads of pandas. See the README.md file for examples and guided tutorials

api_scrapin.api_scrapin.aggregate_city_data(n, zwsid)¶

Return joined dataframes from the n biggest cities in the United States and joins region-id’s for all of those cities along with demographic data for all of those cities

ARGS:

n: int of the number of cities you would like to return aggregated data for

zwsid: string your API key from Zillow
RETURNS:

a pandas.DataFrame with all of the neighborhoods, median housing prices, longitude & latitude, etc.
api_scrapin.api_scrapin.config_dict(path)¶

Load your configuration file to do the API calls into a dictionary. The remainder of the functions assume a{‘website’:{‘username’: , ‘OAthToken’: }} pairing

api_scrapin.api_scrapin.demographics_from_id(regionid, zwsid)¶

Given a region id (which was extracted using the regional_data() or aggregate_city_data() functions) and a Zillow OAthToken, return all of the demographic data for that region-id

ARGS:

regionid: string of the region id

zwsid: string of the Zillow OAthToken
RETURNS:

pandas.Series with all pertinent demographic information for that regionid

Note

findChildren parameter, attribute

In the demographics API call, the ‘attribute’ tag is where all of the pertinent data is housed, so that tag is used below for the BeautifulSoup.findChildren() below

api_scrapin.api_scrapin.extract_tags(tag_list)¶

Take in a list of bs4.element.Tag and returns the Union of the majority of tag.names as a dictionary to then iterate over

ARGS:

tag_list: list of bs4.element.Tag
RETURNS:

key: string the name of the tag that should be used as the “key” (ie appears in all of the list values)

tags: list the remaining tags that should be used to to append to the dictionary
api_scrapin.api_scrapin.largest_cities(n=15)¶

Access the wikipedia page List of US Cities by Population and pull in the n largest into pandas.DataFrame

ARGS:n: class:int of the number of the largest cities you would like returns
RETURNS:pandas.DataFrame of the n largest cities with columns ['2013 rank', 'City', 'State', '2013 estimate']
api_scrapin.api_scrapin.regional_data(param_dict)¶

Calls the GetRegionChildren API from Zillow, with a dict of parameters

ARGS:

param_dict: dictionary with the following parameters

{‘zws-id’, ‘state’, ‘city’}
api_scrapin.api_scrapin.state_abreviation(state_name)¶

The state dictionary has pairings (‘abreviation’, ‘state’), this returs the abreviation for a given value

ARGS:state_name: string of the state
RETURNS:string of the abbreviation of the state
